meanings.definition: To expose to public ridicule or abuse.
meanings.sent1: The mean kids were pillorying the new student for wearing glasses.
meanings.sent2: The tabloids enjoy pillorying celebrities for their fashion choices.
meanings.sent3: The comedian couldn't resist pillorying the politician's funny hat.
meanings.sent4: The internet trolls were pillorying the singer's latest music video.
meanings.sent5: The gossip magazines love pillorying famous couples for their relationships.

meanings.sent1: The coach was pillorying the players for their poor performance on the field.
meanings.sent2: The movie critic enjoys pillorying films that don't meet his standards.
meanings.sent3: The teacher was pillorying the students for not completing their homework.
meanings.sent4: The boss was pillorying the employees for their lack of productivity.
meanings.sent5: The journalist was pillorying the government official for his controversial statements.
